summary: Email chain between attorney Gloria Allred and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding scheduling a meeting for one of Allred's clients, an Epstein victim, to meet with federal prosecutors in New York on August 19, 2019. The emails discuss travel arrangements and a previous client who declined to meet.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney communicating with the U.S. Attorney's office to arrange a meeting for her client, an Epstein victim, with federal prosecutors.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Allred's assistant who was to be contacted by a federal agent to arrange travel details for Allred's client.

connections.description: Allred instructs the federal agent to contact her assistant Diane Aldrich to arrange travel details for her client.
Professional correspondence regarding scheduling a meeting between Allred's client (an Epstein victim) and federal prosecutors.

events.title: Scheduled meeting with federal prosecutors
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for August 19, 2019, at 2 p.m. at the U.S. Attorney's office in New York for Gloria Allred and her client (an Epstein victim) to meet with federal prosecutors.

events.title: Client declines to meet with prosecutors
events.description: On August 9, 2019, Gloria Allred informed the U.S. Attorney's office that another one of her clients, an Epstein victim, had decided not to meet with them.

keyFacts: Gloria Allred, a prominent attorney, was representing multiple clients who were victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
Allred arranged for one client to fly from Los Angeles to New York to meet with federal prosecutors on August 19, 2019.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively seeking to meet with Epstein victims in August 2019.
Another of Allred's Epstein victim clients had previously decided not to meet with prosecutors, indicating the difficult decision victims faced in coming forward.
The correspondence shows coordination between victim attorneys and federal authorities regarding victim travel and meetings.
